channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: At least quarter of Gaza wounded have 'life-changing injuries': WHO
item.description: The World Health Organization reveals that at least a quarter of those injured in Gaza's conflict have life-changing injuries requiring extensive rehabilitation. Over 22,500 people need long-term care. With only 17 out of 36 hospitals partially functional, immediate and sustained support is crucial to meet the overwhelming healthcare needs in the area.

item.title: 'Something was catastrophically wrong': Alaska Airlines pilot recalls moments when plane's door blew out
item.description: An Alaska Airlines pilot managed to land a Boeing 737 Max 9 safely after a door panel blew out mid-flight. The emergency happened shortly after takeoff from Portland, necessitating an urgent return to the airport. Although there were no fatalities, three passengers sustained minor injuries. A lawsuit has been filed against Alaska Airlines and Boeing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'It’s on video on internet': Musk reshares Harris' old video backing gender transition surgeries in prison
item.description: A resurfaced 2019 video features Vice President Kamala Harris advocating taxpayer-funded gender transition surgeries for prisoners, drawing criticism from former President Donald Trump. During a recent debate, Harris reaffirmed her support for comprehensive medical treatment for transgender individuals relying on state care, emphasizing the importance of access to necessary surgical procedures.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Model Maecee Lathers seen face down, topless and vomiting in Miami after crash that killed 2
item.description: Maecee Lathers, a social media model from New York, faces serious charges for allegedly causing a fatal crash in Miami while under the influence of 'pink cocaine.' The incident resulted in two deaths and one injury. Disoriented at the scene, she attempted to flee and made bizarre statements. Her pretrial hearing is scheduled for September 16.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Norfolk Southern fires CEO and Indian origin lawyer over 'inappropriate relationship'
item.description: Norfolk Southern Corporation dismissed CEO Alan Shaw and terminated Executive Vice President Nabanita C Nag after discovering their inappropriate relationship. Mark R George has been appointed as the new President and CEO, effective immediately. Jason A Zampi will serve as acting Chief Financial Officer during this transition period.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Hunting for a woman alone': Homeless man stabbed US student 46 times
item.description: Shawn Laval Smith, a homeless man, has been convicted for the brutal murder of UCLA student Brianna Kupfer in 2022. He stabbed her 46 times while she worked alone in a Los Angeles furniture store. The jury found him guilty of murder and using a deadly weapon. A sanity phase will now determine his mental state during the attack.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Democrats claiming Florida Senate seat is in play haven't put money behind the effort to make it so
item.description: Florida Democrats are optimistic about their chances against incumbent Republican Sen. Rick Scott but face a significant funding disadvantage. Debbie Mucarsel-Powell leads the Democratic challenge, focusing on issues like reproductive rights. Despite some grassroots momentum and support from Kamala Harris' campaign, national Democrats have not heavily invested in Florida's costly media markets.

item.title: Fall from balcony? FBI probes death of 12-year-old boy on Royal Caribbean cruise
item.description: The FBI is probing the death of a 12-year-old boy who fell from a balcony on Royal Caribbean's Harmony of the Seas. The incident occurred during the final night of a seven-day cruise. The FBI, in collaboration with US Coast Guard and Customs and Border Protection, seeks to uncover more details about this tragic event.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Trump and Harris shake hands again at 9/11 memorial after heated debate
item.description: On the anniversary of 9/11, victims' families gathered at ground zero. President Biden, former President Trump, and Vice President Harris set aside political differences to pay respects. Some relatives urged action on Saudi involvement and justice for Khalid Sheikh Mohammed. The event also included a visit to the Flight 93 National Memorial in Pennsylvania.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: From Chinese to Italians and beyond, maligning culture via its foods is longtime American habit
item.description: The article examines how immigrant and minority communities in the US have faced false accusations about their eating habits, suggesting they don't belong. It focuses on a recent false claim against Haitian immigrants in Ohio and traces similar stereotypes throughout American history, despite the expansion of the American palate.

item.title: New sculpture of Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip divides netizens
item.description: Sculptures of Queen Elizabeth II, Prince Philip, and two corgis were recently unveiled in Northern Ireland's Antrim Castle Gardens. While some viewers appreciated the statues in person, social media users criticized their likeness to the late Queen. The bronze sculptures were created by artist Anto Brennan and commissioned by Antrim and Newtonabbey Borough Council.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: White House urged to 'cease and desist' censoring online content on social media
item.description: The House Oversight subcommittee chair has requested the Biden-Harris administration to disclose all White House communications with social media companies about their efforts to censor online content. Following a Supreme Court ruling favoring the administration, the letter urges ceasing such activities and ensuring no political pressure is exerted on social media platforms.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Fact checking only Trump': US Presidential debate blasted for ‘bias’ towards Harris
item.description: ABC News is under fire for alleged bias during the presidential debate between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump. Analysts like Mark Halperin and Megyn Kelly criticized the moderators for being lenient on Harris while rigorously fact-checking Trump. This perceived favoritism has sparked widespread criticism from political commentators and social media users.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ​​Hurricane Francine hits Louisiana with destructive winds, causing power cuts to over 190,000 customers​​
item.description: Hurricane Francine made landfall in Louisiana as a Category 2 storm, causing power outages for about 190,000 customers and severe flooding. With winds near 100 mph, the storm hit Terrebonne Parish and is expected to bring heavy rain and potential flash flooding as it moves inland toward Mississippi. Residents are advised to stay indoors.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala makes expressions her weapon while Trump yells into mic
Biden seeks 'full accountability' after death of US national in West Bank
US aircraft carrier in the Middle East is heading home
item.description: The Pentagon's decision to keep two Navy aircraft carriers in the Middle East has concluded as the USS Theodore Roosevelt heads home. The USS Abraham Lincoln remains in the region to protect Israel and US troops from potential Iranian threats amid ongoing conflict with Hamas. This marks a significant shift in US military presence.

item.title: An Ohio city reshaped by Haitian immigrants lands in an unwelcome spotlight
item.description: Springfield, Ohio, has undergone economic revitalization driven by Haitian immigrants. False claims about Haitians eating pets have fueled fear and division in the community. Local leaders emphasize the positive contributions of immigrants and work to address challenges amid rising tensions.

item.title: Peru's former president Alberto Fujimori passes away after battle with cancer
item.description: Alberto Fujimori, former President of Peru, has died at age 86 after a long battle with cancer. His presidency from 1990 to 2000 included economic reforms and defeating guerrilla violence but ended in corruption scandal. Later, he fled to Japan and faxed his resignation. In 2009, he was sentenced to prison for human rights crimes.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: American footballer Patrick Mahomes refuses to endorse any presidential candidate after Donald Trump praised wife Britanny
item.description: Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes declared he will not endorse any presidential candidate, stressing the importance of voter registration and informed decision-making. He highlighted his and his wife Brittany's community efforts to empower voices. Despite political comments, Mahomes remains focused on personal and professional life.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
